Package org.thewhitemage13.handler

Class UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl

java.lang.Object
org.thewhitemage13.handler.UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
@Component @KafkaListener(topics="user.deleted") public class UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl extends Object implements org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
Handles Kafka events related to user deletions.

This component listens to messages on the "user.deleted" topic and processes them to remove all comments associated with the deleted user. It implements the UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface to ensure adherence to the defined contract for user deletion event handling.

Key Features:

  • Subscribes to the "user.deleted" Kafka topic.
  • Processes UserEvent messages to identify deleted users.
  • Deletes all comments made by the deleted user via CommentServiceImpl.
  • Handles potential exceptions, such as CommentNotFoundException and MediaNotFoundException.

Usage:

This handler is automatically managed by Spring's dependency injection and is triggered whenever a relevant message is published to the "user.deleted" topic.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Method Details

    • userDeleted

      @KafkaHandler public void userDeleted(org.thewhitemage13.UserEvent userEvent) throws org.thewhitemage13.exception.MediaNotFoundException, CommentNotFoundException
      Handles events indicating that a user has been deleted.

      This method processes UserEvent messages to retrieve the user ID and delete all associated comments. If no comments or related media are found for the given user ID, the appropriate exceptions may be thrown.

      Specified by:
      userDeleted in interface org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
      Parameters:
      userEvent - the event containing the ID of the deleted user
      Throws:
      CommentNotFoundException - if no comments are found for the given user ID
      org.thewhitemage13.exceptions.MediaNotFoundException - if no media is found for the given user ID
